params.priceFeedAddress: Chainlink price feed address for the token
Chainlink price feed address for the token

returns._0: A list of supported payment token addresses

params.from: Index of the first registration to return (inclusive)
params.to: Index of the last registration to return (exclusive)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.blsProofOfPossession: BLS proof of possession (public key + signature)
params.validationDuration: Duration of the validation in seconds

params.validationDuration: Duration of the validation in seconds

params.beneficiary: User on whose behalf the registration is made
params.blsProofOfPossession: BLS proof of possession (public key + signature)
params.qiAmount: The amount of QI that was staked
params.validationDuration: Duration of the validation in seconds

params.blsProofOfPossession: BLS proof of possession (public key + signature)
params.validationDuration: Duration of the validation in seconds

params.blsProofOfPossession: BLS proof of possession (public key + signature)
params.validationDuration: Duration of the validation in seconds

params.failed: True if the validator could not be started, false otherwise
params.nodeId: Node ID of the expired validator

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.newMaximumAvaxDeposit: New maximum AVAX deposit amount (18 decimals)
params.newMinimumAvaxDeposit: New minimum AVAX deposit amount (18 decimals)

params.newMaximumSubsidisationAmount: New maximum subsidisation amount in AVAX (18 decimals)

params.amount: Amount of AVAX to be withdrawn

addPaymentToken(address,address,uint256).notice: Add a new fee payment token option

configurePriceFeed(address,address,uint2.notice: Update the price feed configuration for a pre-existing payment token

getAccountRegistrationCount(address).notice: Returns the number of registrations made by the given account

getErc20PaymentMethods().notice: Get a list of all supported ERC-20 payment token for the fee model

getRegistrationFee(uint256).notice: Get the registration fee in AVAX for a given validation duration

getRegistrationsByAccount(address,uint25.notice: Returns an array of registrations made by the given account

getTotalErc20PaymentMethods().notice: Returns the number of available ERC-20 payment tokens for the fee model

pause().notice: Pause new registrations, withdrawals, releases, and redemptions.

redeemAfterExpiry(string).notice: To be called after the validation period has expired and the staker         wants to redeem their deposited tokens and potential rewards.

registerWithAvaxFee(string,bytes,uint256.notice: Register a node by paying a non-refundable fee in AVAX

registerWithErc20Fee(address,string,byte.notice: Register a node by paying a non-refundable fee in a supported ERC-20 token

registerWithPrevalidatedQiStake(address,.notice: Register a new node with a prevalidated QI deposit amount

registerWithStake(string,bytes,uint256).notice: Register a new node for validation and lock up QI and AVAX

registerWithoutCollateral(string,bytes,u.notice: Register a new node for validation without locking up tokens

releaseLockedTokens(string,bool).notice: Called after the validation period has expired and the tokens become         redeemable by the original staker.

removePaymentToken(address).notice: Remove an existing fee payment token option

setAvaxDepositRange(uint256,uint256).notice: Change the required AVAX deposit amount for a registration

setMaximumSubsidisationAmount(uint256).notice: Change the protocol maximum AVAX subsidisation amount

setQiPriceMultiplier(uint256).notice: Update the QI price multiplier used for fee payments in QI

unpause().notice: Resume new registrations, withdrawals, releses, and redemptions.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Called to withdraw AVAX from the contract to start validation

documentation.text: @dev Emitted when a user request validation to be started for a node
@dev Emitted when a registration is removed from the array of registrations
@dev Emitted when AVAX is withdrawn from the contract for validation
@dev Emitted when a validator is slashed for misbehaving
@dev Emitted when the validation period for a node expires and the tokens are redeemable
@dev Emitted when a user redeems their tokens after validation expiry or failed validation start attempt
@dev Emitted when a validator is rewarded
@dev Emitted when QI slash percentage is updated
@dev Emitted when AVAX slash percentage is updated
@dev Emitted when the maximum protocol AVAX subsidisation amount is updated
@dev Emitted when a new fee payment option is added
@dev Emitted when an existing fee payment option is removed
@dev Emitted when a price feed address is updated
@dev Emitted when the registration AVAX requirement is updated
@dev Emitted when the QI price multiplier for fee payments is updated
